units.title: DisCo workflow for individual organoid processing
units.text: Single LGR5+ intestinal stem cells were isolated via FACS and precultured for 3 days under stem cell maintenance conditions (day 0 seeding, ENR CV days 0–3). On day 3, CV was removed from the culture, and organoids differentiated under ENR conditions for up to 3 days. For each day during development (S0–S3), individual organoids were isolated, dissociated and processed on the DisCo platform.
units.rationale: Describes the stepwise preparation and processing of organoids for scRNA‑seq.

units.title: Microfluidic chip fabrication for DisCo
units.text: The PDMS‑based primary replica mold was then silanized and subsequently used to obtain secondary replica molds for PDMS flow layer production. The PDMS and curing agent at a ratio of 5:1, degassed for 15 min, and cured for 60 min at 80 °C. The flow layer was fabricated using PDMS and curing agent at a ratio of 20:1, degassed for 15 min, and cured for 60 min at 80 °C. The control layer was fabricated by spin coating the SU8 photoresist layer at 650 r.p.m. for 35 s with a 15 s ramp time, followed by baking at 80 °C for 30 min. Holes were punched with a 0.5 mm diameter biopsy punch. The two PDMS layers were manually aligned and bonded at 80 °C for at least 60 min.
units.rationale: Provides the concrete steps to produce the deterministic co‑encapsulation chip.

units.title: Cell input quantification and processing
units.text: Input cells (HEK 293T) ranging from 74 to 170 were quantified by impedance measurement. Subsequently, all cells were processed with DisCo, sequenced and quality filtered (>500 UMIs).
units.rationale: Details how cell numbers are measured and processed through DisCo.

units.title: Species mixing experiment using DisCo
units.text: HEK 293T and murine IBA cells were processed with the DisCo workflow for scRNA‑seq, the barcodes merged and the species separation visualized as a Barnyard plot.
units.rationale: Shows a protocol for validating cell capture specificity.

units.title: Cell capture efficiency assessment
units.text: We found that on average, 91.4% of all droplets contain a cell and a bead, and only 1.7% contain an independent cell doublet (Fig. 1f).
units.rationale: Reports the measurement of co‑encapsulation purity.

units.title: Droplet generation and occupancy measurement
units.text: With all components operating in tight orchestration, we were able to generate monodisperse emulsions with high purity (Fig. 1e and Supplementary Video 2).
units.rationale: Describes the operational step to produce uniform droplets.

units.title: RNA in situ detection (RNAscope) in organoids
units.text: We used an RNA fluorescence in situ hybridization assay, RNAscope, to localize Ly6a, Fabp1 and Muc2 expression in organoid sections.
units.rationale: Provides the method to validate marker expression spatially.

units.title: FACS sorting and seeding of LGR5+ and LY6A+ cells
units.text: Single LGR5+ LY6A− and LGR5− LY6A+ cells were isolated by FACS and seeded in Matrigel. Cells were cultured as shown in Fig. 2a and imaged using bright‑field microscopy at S3.
units.rationale: Outlines the sorting and culture steps for distinct cell populations.

units.title: Impedance‑based cell counting for low‑input samples
units.text: Input cells (HEK 293T) ranging from 74 to 170 were quantified by impedance measurement.
units.rationale: Highlights a technique for accurate low‑cell‑number quantification.
